summary: This is a U.S. Department of Justice Office of the Inspector General evidence custody document and chain of custody log related to property seized from the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York. It records the seizure of MCC Control Center 30-day files from July and August 2019, likely following Jeffrey Epstein's death in custody.

events.title: Seizure of MCC Control Center Files
events.description: Property seized from BOP MCC (Metropolitan Correctional Center) including Control Center 30-day files covering dates from July 22, 2019 to August 14, 2019.

events.title: Evidence Transfer to OIG Storage
events.description: Seized items 1-3 were released to DOJ OIG for inventory/storage as part of chain of custody procedures.

locations: BOP MCC (Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York)
keyFacts: Evidence was seized from the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) on August 26, 2019, shortly after Jeffrey Epstein's death in custody on August 10, 2019.
The seized property includes MCC Control Center 30-day files covering the period from July 22, 2019 to August 14, 2019, which would include records around the time of Epstein's death.
The document shows DOJ Office of the Inspector General involvement in evidence collection and chain of custody procedures following Epstein's death.
The evidence custody process involved multiple transfers including placement in overnight drop boxes and evidence safes with witness verification.
This appears to be part of the investigation into Epstein's death while in federal custody at the MCC.
